column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Summary1=(human1) The owner of some paintings shows them to someone and tells how his wife fell in love with art by Jewish Mexican artist Leonardo Nierman on a trip to Mexico twenty five years ago, where they bought a painting of a Mexican woman with a watermelon on her head for $30, and recounts how his father-in-law bought him his first piece of art, by Geri Rae, for his office.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) During a trip to Mexico City 25 years ago, the speaker recalls exploring art galleries and being interested in two Jewish artists - Nierman's expensive paintings that his wife loved and LeRoy Neiman's sports artwork.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) Alan reminisces about a trip to Mexico City where his wife Rae was enamored with a Mexican artist named Nierman, although Alan was hesitant to spend a significant amount on art, recalling the city's vibrant art scene, the cab rides, and his enjoyable and inexpensive painting purchases, juxtaposed with his later discovery of LeRoy Neiman's sports art in a gallery.

#Summary4=(Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) Alan recounts his 25-year-old story of visiting Mexico City with his wife and friends, where they saw an artist named Nierman, who was a Mexican national, and his paintings, which were very inexpensive.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) During a trip to Mexico City with family, the narrator encountered two different Mexican artists, LeRoy Neiman (a sports artist) and Leonardo Nierman (an art colony member), whose works initially seemed too expensive for the narrator's tastes despite being intrigued by them.
#Text=Had a pouch , like , sorta like you 've got .
#Text=I carried it around .
#Text=Well any rate , my wife had fallen in love , with a , Mexican artist by the name of Nierman .

#Text=Mm .

#Text=His paintings sold , f- for generally , a thousand dollars plus , which was , for me —

#Text=First of all I did n't like him .

#Text=Albert and Marcia had one of his paintings , they had — they had — I I do n't know , Marcia had a relative in Mexico , or something .
#Text=But they 'd been down there , many times and , and they had his book , and , we got down there , and he was , uh , all over the place .
#Text=His paintings were — he lived in Mexico City .
#Text=And uh , we had a cab driver , uh , that was gon na take us to , wherever the place where the gold was .

#Text=Yeah .

#Text=An old car and , anyway .

#Text=We were getting out , we had him about three days , one day we took him down to wherever we went .
#Text=Buddy and Sue did n't go , but he took us to the ruins , and all that stuff .
#Text=You know , uh , you know , I and I I knew then , and I know now , that those guys , take you to a particular place , they get a commission .
#Text=Well , they took us to this guy 's studio .
#Text=He what ?
#Text=Took us to this guy – artist 's studio .

#Text=And she saw a painting she liked .
#Text=And , uh , he wanted that damn recorder .
#Text=And he said I tell you what I 'll do , make you a deal .
#Text=He said I 'll — " you take this painting , I want that recorder , I 'll take it . "
#Text=Could — naw I ca n't do that , it 's not mine .
#Text=It was — it 's about a thousand dollar swap .
#Text=Shit I thought my wife was gon na have a fit , she was pissed off .
#Text=Mexico City was a , uh in those days , probably still is , not —
#Text=For this guy he was very successful .
#Text=Uh , very prolific .
#Text=But it was an art colony , and there were a lot of Americans down there .
#Text=He was not an American .
#Text=A lot of Americans down there , uh because , cost of living was so cheap at the time .
#Text=And they – they had these art shows everywhere .
#Text=Well we bought a painting , uh , of a little Mexican woman , still got it , with a watermelon on her head , like it a lot .
#Text=Think I paid thirty dollars for it .
#Text=Well that was about my price range .
#Text=Uh , while I was down there , we may have bought a couple of other i- inexpensive paintings , maybe collectively we bought , maybe spent a hundred and fifty dollars .
#Text=Uh , hell I was not an art — we were n't art collectors .
#Text=And uh , to spend a thousand dollars , to me for a painting , was unthinkable .
#Text=Uh , the s- first painting I ever bought , my father - in - law bought it from Geri f- , Geri Rae , it was one of Geri 's original early early paintings , which I thoroughly enjoy .
#Text=She 's changed styles but , while we were down there , uh —
#Text=You know I —
#Text=This — it —
#Text=I 've seen that somewhere before .
#Text=You know I 've had that painting for thirty - five years I guess .
#Text=I – I 've never framed it .
#Text=And I really like it .
#Text=Uh , my — my my father - in - law wanted to give me a painting for my — piece of art for my office .
#Text=And so I had a — we had a display guy at the time , by the name of Ben Money , fashioned himself as an artist .
#Text=And I said " Ben , pick me out something , you 've got fifty bucks to spend . "
#Text=So , he got this from Geri , and I loved it .
#Text=It 's beautiful .
#Text=And and , I can see all kind a things in it .
#Text=It 's got a lot ta color and —

#Text=I see a Chinese junk .

#Text=Well , we looked at a lot of art , in in in the , in the , uh parks , and there at least it was , pleasant weather and , like that uh , it was sorta like , uh .

#Text=And uh , most of em , very inexpensive .
#Text=Uh starving artists that were down there , lots of American .
#Text=Well , uh , we wandered around down in the , the area which , I 've forgotten the area that they called , in Mexico City where , uh , most of the jewelry shops are and things .
#Text=It 's got a name .

#Text=They also had a lot of , uh , artist galleries down there .
#Text=And I walked into this gallery , during one of our — we were down there maybe ten days .
#Text=And I saw this guy Nierman .

#Text=He he he got famous at the nineteen , uh , probably seventy - two Olympics .
#Text=Uh , but his c- — his art was already in collections of guys like Edward G. Robinson , it was very popular in Hollywood .
#Text=He also was very prolific .

#Text=And I walked in , and there must have been about , twelve or fifteen paintings in there .

#Text=But any rate , but uh , this guy 's name was LeRoy Neiman , I 'd never heard of him , well I 'd heard of Nierman .
#Text=Uh , because Rae went down there wanting to buy one of those paintings .
#Text=These were paintings , which I 'd say were about the size of this Joe Namath there , which is a seriograph .
#Text=And , we went in , and uh , they were just back from Acapulco , season was just over in Acapulco .
#Text=And he had about fifteen twenty paintings , twenty - five paintings , football players , horse races , that 's what he did , they were about that size .
#Text=I 'd been in there , oh God I looked at em , they just struck me as something , I loved em .
